(4 comments)
Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged
Looks like there was some mistake in what patch got uploaded here?
The patchset accidently dropped key changes to the ikvm_server.cpp and ikvm_video.cpp files.  I have fixed the omission.

A slightly more descriptive commit message would be good -- it looks like a small structural change to allow using pixel formats other than the JPEG format we had previously been assuming/hardcoding, but then appears to only actually add support for one other format (RGB24), whereas this description makes it sound broader than that (to me at least).
agreed, description updated.

Is the removal of these blank lines something clang-format demanded?  If not, it'd be preferable to avoid including a bunch of unrelated whitespace changes (and if they are required, a separate cleanup patch would be nice).
Please see change https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/obmc-ikvm/+/61514 to address this comment.  I have separated the whitespace change to change 61514.

This error message potentially getting triggered on every frame sounds like a lot of log spam; could we move this to when we retrieve the pixel format via the `VIDIOC_G_FMT` ioctl so that if it does get triggered it's not a flood of the same repeated message?

I have updated the change to address this by placing a check for pixel format compatibility in the Video::start member function.  An removed the compatibility check in the Server::sendFrame member function.  On failure during sendFrame no update is sent.
size_t seems like an odd choice for this; might uint32_t be slightly more appropriate?
I agree uint32_t is a more appropriate choice.  I have used unsigned as per the CPP style guidelines @ https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/cpp-style-and-conventions.md

Ah, yes I see -- in this case though I think the fact that the ioctl interface itself is defined in terms of an explicitly-sized type (https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/latest/userspace-api/media/v4l/pixfmt-v4l2.html#c.v4l2_pix_format) would be sufficient reason to use one here as well to match it.  (I've submitted a docs patch to clarify that here: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/docs/+/61962)
Done

This looks like an appropriate level of detail -- the formatting is a bit off from the usual commit-message style though: https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#formatting-commit-messages

Something like:

```
Add V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB24 pixel format support

This is the format used by the gxp v4l2 driver.
```

would be good I think.
Done
The usual commit-message format leaves a blank line separating any trailing metadata-tag footer lines (Change-Id, Signed-off-by, etc.) from the main body text.
Done
Just a few little formatting things, otherwise this looks good to go.

Not sure why I didn't see this on the previous revision(s), but I'd prefer to avoid mixing in unrelated whitespace change.  At least in my environment clang-format (via format-code.sh) doesn't seem to be adding this, so I'd expect CI should be fine with just putting the empty line back in.
Done
...and here.
Done
Likewise here...
Done
